page.title: 16COINAGEHALL STREET (2)
page.content: In 1810 the building was demolished. The name Coinagehall Street is derived from this original hall. Originally the street was known as {Lady Street} after the Chapel of Our Lady which once stood at its lower end. Leading up from Coinagehall Street is Wendron Street where {Bob {Fitzsimmons}was born on May 26th 1863. He was the Middleweight boxing champion of the world in 1891. He went on to become the Heavyweight champion of the world between 1897-9. To commemorate his achievement as Britain's only world heavyweight boxing champion a pub was named after him in Coinagehall Street.
